message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.HC 

This paper deals with the problem of understanding human activities and object affordances from RGB-D videos, which involves computer vision, robotics, and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the use of this understanding in performing assistive tasks by a PR2 robot, which falls under the category of cs.RO (Robotics). The paper uses a structural support vector machine (SSVM) approach for learning, which is a machine learning technique and falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The paper also discusses the accuracy of the labeling, which is a performance evaluation metric and falls under the category of cs.LG (Machine Learning). Finally, the paper discusses the importance of understanding human activities and object affordances for personal robots, which falls under the category of cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction).
